question_sentence: The vice-president of which East African country was among those killed in a plane crash on Monday?
evidence: Vice-President Saulos Chilima and nine other passengers were killed when their military aircraft crashed in low visibility conditions over a national reserve. Find out more about what this means for the future of one of Africa's poorest countries in this week's episode of The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Apple unveiled which new feature at its Worldwide Developers Conference?
evidence: Apple revealed new features including the ability to schedule text messages, send texts via satellite when necessary, and record and transcribe calls from the phone app. Notably, it's enhancing Siri and other apps with AI, calling it "Apple Intelligence".

question_sentence: American Bill May narrowly missed the cut to become the first man to compete in which Olympic discipline?
evidence: May, 45, missed out on a spot in the USA squad for the Paris Olympics. But World Aquatics, which oversees the sport formerly known as synchronised swimming, said it was "absolutely determined" that men will participate at the 2028 Summer Games in Los Angeles.

question_sentence: Joe Biden's son Hunter was convicted of what on Tuesday?
evidence: Hunter Biden was convicted on three criminal charges. He was found guilty of lying about his drug use to purchase a handgun and illegally possessing the firearm for 11 days in October 2018.

question_sentence: Which Israeli minister quit Benjamin Netanyahu's war cabinet with a swipe at the prime minister?
evidence: Gantz, the popular leader of the National Unity party, said Netanyahu's fixation on "total victory" over Hamas was prolonging the conflict and putting the lives of Israeli hostages at risk.

question_sentence: Which UN Security Council member country this week abstained from endorsing a US-backed ceasefire deal for Gaza?
evidence: The UN Security Council voted 14-0 on a three-stage plan approved by Israel's war cabinet. The "unusual show of relative unity by a deeply divided Security Council" puts pressure on Israel and Hamas to reach an agreement.

question_sentence: The leader of which party stunned the French political establishment by offering to team up with the far-right National Rally?
evidence: In shambolic scenes, leader Eric Ciotti locked himself in the party's headquarters in an apparent attempt to keep his colleagues from holding an emergency meeting to sack him. Interim leader François-Xavier Bellamy will now lead the centre-right party into the snap election.

question_sentence: At a rally in Las Vegas, Donald Trump described an unusual scenario involving which sea animal?
evidence: During his speech, the former president veered off on a tangent about whether he'd rather die by electrocution in a sinking electric boat or face a hungry shark waiting for him in nearby waters. This fixation with sharks appears to be a recurring theme in many of his public addresses.

question_sentence: Which of these pledges is not in the Labour Party's general election manifesto?
evidence: The garden cities are part of the Liberal Democrats' manifesto, also unveiled this week. Leader Ed Davey said creating new towns would help the party reach its goal of building 380,000 new homes a year, almost half of them social housing.

question_sentence: What demographic group was found among the Mayan remains thought to have been ritually sacrificed?
evidence: DNA analysis discovered that the 64 Mayan remains discovered near Chichén Itzá in Mexico in 1967 were mostly boys between the ages of three and six, and many were closely related. Among the remains were two sets of twins.

question_sentence: World leaders gathered in which country for the annual G7 summit?
evidence: The leaders of the world's most powerful economies convened in Italy for crucial policy discussions. Support for Ukraine and its ongoing war with Russia are key topics of the meetings this year.

question_sentence: Which company unveiled new artificial intelligence upgrades for its products this week?
evidence: Apple introduced a suite of AI capabilities known as “Apple Intelligence.” The company also announced a partnership with OpenAI that will integrate ChatGPT into many Apple devices.

question_sentence: Which member of the Biden family was convicted on felony charges this week?
evidence: A federal jury found Hunter Biden guilty Tuesday on all three federal felony gun charges he faced, concluding that he violated laws meant to prevent drug addicts from owning firearms.

question_sentence: Which state was hammered by heavy rain and life-threatening floods this week?
evidence: A deluge of rain caused widespread flooding in South Florida, prompting Gov. Ron DeSantis to declare a state of emergency for several counties.

question_sentence: Which airline has offered $10,000 in compensation to passengers injured by severe turbulence?
evidence: Singapore Airlines has offered $10,000 in compensation to passengers hurt last month during a flight that encountered severe turbulence. Other passengers who sustained more serious injuries were offered $25,000, according to the carrier.

question_sentence: Which facilities in the US have been targeted by hackers and cybercriminals in recent weeks?
evidence: America’s rural hospitals keep getting attacked by cybercriminals. Microsoft and Google announced they will offer free or discounted cybersecurity services to some hospitals to help prevent disruptions to patient care.

question_sentence: What is the acronym for the United States’ disaster relief agency?
evidence: The Federal Emergency Management Agency, or FEMA, is the nation's disaster relief agency. Climate experts expect FEMA will run out of money before the 2024 hurricane season is over due to several costly weather disasters this year.

question_sentence: Which Disney ride is being replaced after facing years of criticism?
evidence: A ride based on the story of Disney's first Black princess opens to the public this month in Orlando, Florida, replacing the decades-old Splash Mountain attraction that was widely criticized for portraying racial stereotypes.

question_sentence: Which awards honor culinary achievement in the United States?
evidence: The James Beard Awards, also known as the Oscars of the food world, were handed out Monday to esteemed chefs and restaurants across the US.

question_sentence: K-pop star Jin was greeted by fanfare this week after he finished his mandatory army service in South Korea. Which boy band is he a member of?
evidence: Jin, the oldest member of K-pop phenomenon BTS, was discharged from South Korea’s army on Wednesday after serving 18 months of mandatory duty.

question_sentence: What is the recent TikTok trend involving GloRilla’s song and AI tools?
choices: Users are posting videos of themselves singing along to GloRilla’s songs.
Users are uploading AI-animated videos of their loved ones dancing to GloRilla’s song using CapCut & Viggle.AI tools.
Users are competing in a live dance-off to GloRilla’s music.
Users are creating memes about GloRilla without using any AI tools.

question_sentence: What achievement did Danny Childs, a University of Delaware graduate, recently receive?
choices: A Michelin Star for his restaurant
A James Beard Foundation Media Award for his cocktail book

question_sentence: What is the current status of the four massive blue attraction signs located along Interstate 95 and exit ramps in Wilmington?
choices: They have been fully updated with attractions and businesses.
They are partially filled with some attractions but still missing many.
They remain blank after nearly a year since their installation.
They have been taken down due to public dissatisfaction.

question_sentence: What makes Trolley Square in Wilmington, Delaware, stand out as an urban haven?
choices: Its ranking as the number one urban haven in the US.
The unique mix of bars, restaurants, and shops that create a lively atmosphere.
Its large size and impersonal city environment.
The absence of natural landscapes and outdoor spaces.

question_sentence: What is the main reason for the federal lawsuit against Delaware Insurance Commissioner Trinidad Navarro?
What is one of the main reasons for the significant rebound of oyster populations in the Chesapeake Bay?
choices: Introduction of a new oyster species
Ongoing conservation efforts in specific locations
Increased water temperatures in the bay

question_sentence: What is the primary purpose of Senate Bill 328 proposed by State Senator Eric Buckson?
choices: To allow high school athletes to profit from name/image/likeness opportunities.
To create separate state championships for public and private schools to ensure a level playing field.
To merge public and private school championships into a single event.
To provide additional funding for public schools’ athletic programs.

question_sentence: What amenities does Banning Regional Park offer for picnickers?
choices: Free parking, picnic pavilions with barbecue grills, restrooms, and a dog park.
A museum pass program and urban wildlife habitat.
Rock-climbing walls and the Brandywine River.
Tennis courts and a fitness circuit leading to a pond.

question_sentence: What is the primary goal of the social equity workshops being held by the Office of the Marijuana Commissioner in Delaware?
choices: To provide legal assistance to individuals with past marijuana convictions.
To inform potential applicants about the process of obtaining a social equity license.
To offer financial support to applicants for marijuana business licenses.
To discuss the effects of the War on Drugs in the 1970s.

question_sentence: What was the outcome of Hunter Biden’s federal gun trial?
choices: The jury could not reach a verdict.
Hunter Biden was found not guilty on all charges.
Hunter Biden was found guilty on some charges.
Hunter Biden was found guilty on all charges.
